AWS so on the software side we we do a
multi-part HTTP upload directly to s3
and when you drag and drop a file into
frame i/o we break it up into thousands
of little chunks and we do parallel HTTP
uploads and then we reassemble all those
pieces on on s3 to
to have one file so doing all those
little individual chunks gets over the
inherent speed limitations of HTTP HTTP
was never designed for speed and then on
the infrastructure side we use Amazon's
s3 accelerate which is kind of like
cloud front in Reverse when somebody's
uploading a file from Europe they're
uploading to an edge server that's
nearest them and they have a really low
latency connection and then Amazon
manages an accelerated data transfer
from the edge back to our origin data
center in North Virginia so all of those
combined mean you just drag and drop
